messages.subject: Re: [SHQ] Re: IT WORKED!!!!!
messages.msgSnippet: Indeed I am an historian. I m an East Asian Studies major, focusing on Japanese history, although I have an active interest in world history, as well. My
messages.messageBody:
Indeed I am an historian. I'm an East Asian Studies major, focusing on
Japanese history, although I have an active interest in world history, as
well. My recommendation to aspiring historians is to study historiography
first, and if they are doing an area study like I am, learn to read, write,
and speak the language of the area. I can NOT stress enough how helpful that
it's been to know Japanese...

If you have any more questions, just feel free to contact me privately. It's
my mission to spread history, especially Japanese history, and make it
accessible to all.

Oh...and if I could sum all this up in one sentence, it would be "Keep the
bigger picture in mind."

--M.

messages.messageBody:
Hello!!!

First of all, congratulations!! ^0^
I have a question for you ^^ Do you, by any chance,
study History?? Then, if it happens to you being
studying that, tell me, where are you studying? And
what are your recomendations for other "Rekishi"
students?

Thanks in advance!

Anariel

messages.subject: IT WORKED!!!!!
messages.msgSnippet: APPROVED!!! The Role of Aizu in the Bakumatsu !!!! My thesis is approved!! HIGHLIGHTS: 1. Role of upper samurai 2. Role of middle samurai 3. Role of lower
messages.messageBody:
APPROVED!!! "The Role of Aizu in the Bakumatsu"!!!! My thesis is approved!!

HIGHLIGHTS:

1. Role of upper samurai
2. Role of middle samurai
3. Role of lower samurai.
4. Role of women.
5. Role of peasants.
6. Role of enemies.
7. Kyoto.
8. Shinsengumi.
9. Allied domains
10. Northern Confederation

etc., etc...you get the picture....


WOOHOOOOOOOOOOOOO!!!!!!!!

*runs off screaming* Seriously, I was so happy running back to my dorm my
pants nearly fell down!!!

--M.
